moves.4. dxe6 Bxe6: Black is ahead in developement... just a bit, since his pieces are not aggressively placed
moves.5. Nf3: Normal. c4 opens me some lines for attack via the black squares and Ne4.
moves.5... c6: The aggressive approach Qe7, thinking in Bc4 to follow is sound, but it is easily met by Qd2 in return, and black has a blocked dsb for nothing.
moves.6. Be2 Nbd7: I wanted to approach the game calmly. My opponent was a 1700+ and I am not in a good shape.
moves.7. O-O Bd6: I am leaving plenty of room for a white's attack on the queenside, but I was confident my opponent didn't seem to go for quick attack either.
moves.8. h3 h6: Profilactic. But I am thinking in g4 and g5 already.
moves.9. Re1: Inviting me to take care of a quick castling.
moves.9... Qc7: Queenside, of course! From far away, black is using white's passivity to load and aim his weapons.
moves.10. c3: Another pawn moves, being so behind in developement...
moves.10... O-O-O 11. Qa4 Kb8 12. b4: Finally, white woke up and took his chance on my king.
moves.12... Nb6 13. Qc2: Here, I must have been sure to avoid c4 (once b4 is defended), but I know that in chess timing is it all.
moves.13... g5 14. a4: Now is the decisive moment. I can always escape via Nc4, so I can use another tempo for my attack.
moves.14... g4 15. hxg4: He thinks that he cannot allow gxN, but in fact, but in fact white's kingside is about to fall.
moves.15... Nxg4 16. b5: ? The losing mistake, as it is not so forcing as a5, or Ne5, maybe.
moves.16... Bh2+: In order to open the way for the Q.
moves.17. Kf1 Nxf2: Anything just to bring the Q there.
moves.18. Nxh2: I think now that Qg6 was the best move, but I played...
moves.20. Bf3 Bd5: Bh3 would have been even better, maybe. White can eschange B, but then my other R will enter the fry.
moves.21. Qd3: Defending f3. Here, I can think about Nc4 or Bc4, but I went for the decisive move almost without thinking, just for instinct.
moves.21... Rxg2+ 22. Bxg2: Not to take could have been a little better, as strange as it may seem. No time to prove it, thoug. From here the mate is almost forced.
